newsitem.title: USA: Learning Co sees debt cut down in three yrs.
newsitem.headline: Learning Co sees debt cut down in three yrs.

text.p: The Learning Co president Kevin O'Leary expects the company's high debt to be pared to a comfortable level in about three years.

The educational and reference software firm had $471 million in debt as of its first quarter ended in March. That is against annual revenues estimated to be $407 million for 1997 and reported at $343.3 million in 1996. The debt has accumulated from several acquisitions in recent years.
"We take cash flow from operations and buy back debt and we will continue to do that," O'Leary said in an interview following a presentation at the Hambrecht & Quist Conference.
"We think we have an adequate plan to get that down over three years (to a more comfortable level)," he said.
Analysts have been concerned about debt and cited it as one of the company's problems in integrating its acquisitions.
Formerly named SoftKey, the company's most significant acquisition was its 1996 purchase of The Learning Co, to which it recently changed its name.
